RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUZIA raced four wide around the first turn, prompt the early pace from the outside four dee, took command near the five sixteenths pole and held a clear lead under steady handling. JUST HAVE FAITH settled off the early going, hard ridden three to four wide around the far turn and rallied well to close in on the winner late while securing second place. VERY VENUS was coaxed along early, vied two deep between just past the three eighth pole and raced even late with no closing run on the top pair. TAPTAP lag early on while trailing, swung wide into the upper stretch and had no rally. LAURA'S GRAND showed good early speed along the inside and gave way. BIT OF BLESSINGS was sent along the inside to lay up close and tired readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Just Have Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, 3-4 wide far turn, rally place

ENTRY.NAME: Taptap
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, swung wide upper stretch, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 25 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILVER RULES chased early on, moved up quickly into the far turn, waited for racing room from the three sixteenths to the eighth pole, slipped through along the rail and finished well to just get up under strong handling. LA MADDALENA was hustled early, raced along the inside around the far turn, angled near the eighth pole to race four deep and rallied gamely to the wire racing four wide. PHANTOM QUEEN dueled for the early lead between rivals and was outkicked in the drive. POLISH THE DIAMOND broke awkwardly then dueled for the early lead near the rail and weakened a bit the final eighth of a mile. OUR GREAT NOTION chased the pace from the outside and tired. SCARLET REBEL pressed three deep and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Rules
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, wait 3/16 to 1/8, rail, just up, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: La Maddalena
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, inside turn, angled 1/8, gamely, 4p

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 25 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOBALLSTWOSTRIKES rated along under a hold early on, moved up to take aim four to five wide around the far turn and finished well to edge up under strong encouragement. C R'S MANDATE settled off the early going, asked nearing the far turn, raced three to two deep through the stretch and finished gamely to the wire. VAIL OF HONOR dropped back off the early going, raced along the inside around the far turn, angled out near the eighth pole and moved up to improve position. MARK DID IT stalked the pace near the inside early, moved up five to six wide through the upper stretch and had not enough. BUDDY BUDDY showed good early speed along the inside and gave way. LORD OF CORK pressed Buddy Buddy from the outside down the backstretch, was bothered a bit near the three eighths pole by loose horse Napa Valley and was empty the final three sixteenths while fading. NAPA VALLEY reared at the break and unseated his rider.

ENTRY.NAME: Vail of Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside far turn, angled 1/8, moved up

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 5-6 wide upper stretch, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 25 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PAYMENGOLD was bumped at the start, tracked the pace along the inside, moved up two to three wide through the far turn, raced four deep near the eighth pole, angled to rail and finished strongly to surge up under strong handling. FOXY SISTA stalked the pace, hard ridden nearing the three sixteenths pole between rivals two deep, dug in and missed in a game effort racing four wide. NOCASHREFUNDS was bumped at the start, raced with the second flight early on, moved up from the outside of rivals around the far turn, swung wide into the lane and rallied well from the outside. JUBA BOUND was bumped at the start, raced mid pack early on, moved up to challenge through the far turn, raced four to five wide in the drive and was outkicked to the wire. GRUMPY'S BUDDY dropped to the back of the pack early on, raced along the inside around the far turn and moved up in the drive while racing three deep to improve position. MAKIN' GOLD was sent along the inside and gave way. LOGSTRADAMUS raced mid pack early, was near the inside and had no final winning bid. I'LLTAKECAREOFIT was forwardly place to lay up close and faded while racing from the outside. NEVERFOLD was bumped at the break, raced near the inside and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: Logstradamus
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, inside, no final bid

ENTRY.NAME: Grumpy's Buddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, inside far turn, moved up, 3wd between

ENTRY.NAME: Paymengold
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break, tracked inside, 4p 1/8, angled rail, up, driving

ENTRY.NAME: Nocashrefunds
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, swung wide, rallied outside

ENTRY.NAME: I'lltakecareofit
ENTRY.COMMENT: up closed, failed to sustain bid, outside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Last Enchantment S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. $50 nominations close Tuesday, August 15, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Tuesday, August 22, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies and all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: Three Years Old 121 lbs.; Older 124 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accu mulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JEFFERSON NATIVE sprinted clearly early on, dug in near the eighth pole and prevailed in a determined run under all out pressure. LITTLE ROO ROO was off slowly, quickly moved up three wide through the far turn after the poor start, took aim near the eighth pole but couldn't get by late in a game effort. PENGUIN POWER was hustled along, raced near inside around the far turn, angled to race off the inside in the drive and finished willingly to the wire. YOUTHINKTHATSFUNNY coaxed along early, swung wide into the upper stretch and raced even late with no closing run. DAN THE MAN CAN was hustled along, raced along the inside around the far turn through the stretch and had no response. GOLDEN KEY hard ridden to vie near the early leader, checked between through the far turn and faded late. Jockey of golden Key claimed objection against Little Roo Roo for interference and stewards ruled no change.

ENTRY.NAME: Dan the Man Can
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Penguin Power
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, inside turn, angled, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Youthinkthatsfunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along, swung wide upper stretch, even

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Autumn S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. $50 nominations close Tuesday, August 15, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Tuesday, August 22, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies and all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: Three Years Old 121 lbs.; Older 124 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to thoseh orses having accumulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRYDA was quick to begin, confidently handled through the far turn, roused near the eighth pole and held safe to prove best under steady handling. MAGGIE'S GIRL was hustled along from the outside early, angled in race near the rail around the far turn, moved up three to four wide in the lane and finished gamely to the wire. GREAT SPIRIT bumped, squeezed back at the start, ridden along early, three deep around the far turn, swung wide and rallied willingly from the far outside. FULL MOON LOVER dropped back to race mid pack while under strong encouragement, raced near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and had no final winning bid. COACH RUBE was hustled along from the outside, raced five wide near the eighth pole and weakened. TIZ THE REASON was coaxed along from the outside of Stryda and faded the final three sixteenths of a mile. SILKY SERENA void of early speed, raced near the inside and had no response. LIGHTNIN RUNNER was bumped, squeezed at the break, raced well off the inside around the far turn into the stretch and never threatened. Jockey of Lightin Runner claimed objection against Full Moon Lover at the break and stewards ruled no change.

ENTRY.NAME: Stryda
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick to begin, confident handled turn, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Lightnin Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, squeezed start, outside, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Full Moon Lover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, hustled along, run, no final bid

ENTRY.NAME: Maggie's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled outside, inside turn, gamely, 3-4 wide

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Russell Road S. Presented by Triple Crown Nutrition CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 107. Stakes Purse 250000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COASTAL MISSION rated along early to race in hand, made a strong three wide bid into the upper stretch, shifted in and edged clear under strong handling. MISH showed good early speed to set the early pace two deep down the backstretch, met the challenge of coastal mission through the upper stretch, dug in and gave way grudgingly to the winner late. SIR ALFRED JAMES stalked the pace, hard ridden through the far turn along the inside into the upper stretch and raced even late with no closing run on the top pair. PAYNE was bumped at the start, raced mid pack early on, raced two deep through the far turn, shifted four wide and moved up and improved position. PRO OXIDANT settled off the early going, raced along the inside to saved ground and had no final winning bid. BENEVENGO was off slowly, raced five wide around far turn, swung wide into the upper stretch and had no late rally. CLASSIER chased the pace from the outside of rivals, raced four wide near the three eighths pole and faded. RADICAL RIGHT was bumped at the start, lag early on and lacked a bid. HOLY SYNCHRONICITY pressed the deep down the backstretch and gave way. BABY YODA was off slowly, raced with the second flight early, raced four deep around the far turn and tired to never threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Coastal Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, 3p upper stretch, shift in, drove clear

ENTRY.NAME: Pro Oxidant
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, saved ground, no final bid

ENTRY.NAME: Radical Right
ENTRY.OWNER: Kagele Tom Kagele Jack A and Kagele Monique B

ENTRY.NAME: Payne
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, 2p far turn, shifted 4p, moved up

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Alfred James
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, inside far turn, even late

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Yoda
ENTRY.OWNER: Pantofel Stable LLC Wachtel Stable Barber Gary and Zaro Jerold L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Misty Bennett Pink Ribbon S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 99. Stakes Purse 250000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOCIETY set his own uncontested early pace, roused under a hand ride through the stretch and was well clear late. FRANK'S ROCKETTE tracked the early leader three deep down the backstretch, ridden along nearing the three eighths pole and was no match for the winner while racing near the inside in the drive. HEARTYCONSTITUTION was off a step slow, stalked the pace along the inside and kept on but was no match for the top pair. SHOSHONI MOON was off slowly, raced three to four wide in the lane and never threatened. MAJESTIC WAYS stalked the top pair along the inside and tired readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Heartyconstitution
ENTRY.OWNER: Sanders Wayne and Highlander Training Center
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, stalked inside, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Society
ENTRY.COMMENT: own pace, well clear, hand ride

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Robert Hilton Memorial S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 105. Stakes Purse 350000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. Free Nominations close Friday, August 11, 2023. $1,750 to enter with a purse of $350,000 Guaranteed. Supplemental nominations of $3,500 will be accepted by the time of closing of entries, all fees included. Horses having won a North American, European or Asian Graded or Group stake will have $1,750 of their entry or supplemental fee refunded upon starting. Entries close Tuesday, August 22, 2023 by the usual time of closing. After payment of 1% to the owners of all horses finishing se venth thru last, 60% of the remaining purse shall be paid to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% to sixth. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a graded or group stake in 2023 allowed 3 lbs.; non-winners of a sweepstake in 2023 allowed 5 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to North American, European and Asian Graded or Group stake winners in order (Grade 1, then Grade 2, then Grade 3), then to highest earnings in
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DAMON'S MOUND dueled just to the outside of Swirvin two deep, dug in through the stretch run and proved best in a determined effort under strong handling. LORD MILES lag early on to race far back early, moved up through the far turn, angled widest in the stretch, surged and closed in belatedly. GHOST HERO settled off the early going along the inside, angled to race from the outside through the far turn into the stretch and finished willingly to the wire. PRINCE OF JERICHO forced six wide into the first turn, raced with the second flight early on, took aim midway through the far turn, raced three to two wide in the drive and was outkicked. RYVIT sent along into the first turn, took back a bit briefly, ridden along to prompt from the outside and weakened a bit in the final stages. SWIRVIN hard sent from the inside to duel along the inside and weakened the final three sixteenths of a mile. PICTURE THIS forced seven wide into the first turn angled in race near the inside down the backstretch and had no late bid. COFFEEWITHCHRIS dropped back off the early pace, raced well off the inside down the backstretch and had no response. SUPER ACCELERATE chased the early pace three deep and faded. TODDCHERO failed to sustain a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Lord Miles
ENTRY.COMMENT: lag early, angled widest, surged, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Toddchero
ENTRY.OWNER: Norman, Mark and Norman Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Ryvit
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt outside, ridden along, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Picture This
ENTRY.COMMENT: 7 wide 1st turn, angled in, no bid

RACE.FOOTNOTES: VAHVA chased the early pace under steady coaxing from the inside, angled three deep through the upper stretch, surged and got up to prove best under strong handling. UNDERVALUED ASSET prompt the early pace three deep from the outside of foes, dug in between and finished gamely to the wire. LATE FROST vied for the early lead along the inside, dug in and gave way late grudgingly. METAPHYSICAL raced mid pack early, ridden along early, raced five wide near the eighth pole and moved up from the outside. LILY POO settled early on, raced two to three wide and raced evenly late with no closing run. IMONRA dropped back off the early pace, raced along the inside around the far turn into the upper stretch and had no final winning bid. INTERPOLATE raced with the second flight early on, raced near the inside around the far turn and never threatened racing three deep. HOOSIER PHILLY ran in the four and five paths on the opening turn and faded after a half mile. OPUS FORTY TWO raced five wide around first turn, coaxed along early and was empty the final quarter of a mile. CHISMOSA failed to sustain a bid.

ENTRY.OWNER: Belladonna Racing LLC Hudson Jr Edward J West Point Thoroughbreds LBD Stable LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: SKIPPYLONGSTOCKING showed good early foot to set his own uncontested pace, roused through the far turn and drew off to be well clear under strong handling. O'CONNOR (CHI) settled off the early pace, raced near the back of the pack early on, advanced into the far turn, raced five to six wide and surged up late for the place position. DASH ATTACK rated along early, hard ridden nearing the three eighths pole, dug in and kept on to secure third placing. MUAD'DIB prompt the pace from the outside of rival and weakened a bit through the drive. CALL ME FAST was off slowly, raced with the second flight early on, was four wide into the upper stretch and weakened late. GIANT GAME rated along the inside, ridden under strong pressure near the three eighths pole and was empty late. DOUBLE CROWN settled off the early going, raced three to four wide and had no response. DOPPELGANGER dropped back to race mid pack early and failed to respond. PERFECT FLIGHT was a bit rank early, checked in the early stages and tired readily. EASTERN BAY was pulled up early and walked off under his own power.

Preference to thoseh orses having accumulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.

SENECA ROCKS settled off the early pace, advanced into the far turn, raced six wide into the upper stretch and finished gamely from the outside. THE SKY IS FALLING settled off the early pace, moved up under a steady rail down the backstretch, raced near the rail around the far turn through the stretch and finished willingly to the wire. CHANGE THE WORLD dropped back off the early pace, raced four wide near the eighth pole, angled out and moved up to improve position. HESSICA stalked the pace, made a strong three wide bid near the eighth pole and faltered the final eighth of a mile. MOONLIT SHADOW was hard sent from the inside, dueled along the inside and faded. LUCYLOU WHO was squeezed back at the start, raced along the inside around the far turn and never threatened. SOMEDAY IS TODAY dueled two deep and was eased up on late. MARZ EXPRESS was pulled up early losing ground and walked off.

Weight: Three Year Olds 121 lbs.; Older 124 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accu mulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.

SOCIAL CHIC vied for the early lead racing two deep, dug in late and kept on gamely to the wire. JUNGLE BEAST dropped back to race mid pack early on, raced five to six wide while making its bid in the drive and made a good late rally. LATE IN THE GAME dropped back early on, moved up from the far outside and closed in belatedly. CANDY INVASION rated along early, raced two wide between in the lane and flattened out.
